details.documented_behavior: `quantity` documented as optional (no) and allowed range 0–10.
details.actual_behavior: `quantity` is required and code enforces 1 <= quantity <= 5; function throws Error when outside this range.

citations.doc: README_backup.md line 12: `| quantity | number | no | Number of items (0–10) |`
citations.code: api.ts lines 3-6 (CreateOrderInput), lines 16-18 (doc comment), lines 21-23 (throw on invalid quantity)

details.fix_summary: Mark `quantity` as required and update allowed range to 1–5; document the thrown error for out-of-range values.

details.actual_behavior: `couponCode` is optional in the code (`couponCode?: string`).

citations.doc: README_backup.md line 13: `| couponCode | string | yes | Discount coupon code |`

details.fix_summary: Mark `couponCode` as optional in the documentation.

details.documented_behavior: Return object documented as `{ success: boolean; orderId?: string; }`.
details.actual_behavior: Function returns `{ orderId: string; totalPrice: number }` and `OrderResult` interface reflects that.

citations.doc: README_backup.md lines 17-21: returns code block showing `success` and optional `orderId`.

details.fix_summary: Update `Returns` section to show `orderId: string` and `totalPrice: number` and explain how `totalPrice` is computed.

details.documented_behavior: No error cases are documented; table suggests `quantity` could be 0–10.
details.actual_behavior: Function throws Error('Invalid quantity') for quantity < 1 or quantity > 5.

citations.doc: README_backup.md: no `Errors` section or mention of thrown errors for invalid `quantity`.
citations.code: api.ts lines 16-18 (doc comment listing invalid quantity conditions), lines 21-23 (throw)

details.fix_summary: Add an `Errors` section documenting that the function throws `Error('Invalid quantity')` when `quantity` is outside 1–5.
